thread.section_title: Technology - Blue Sky Innovation - Chicago Tribune
thread.title: Amazon will ban sale of Apple, Google video-streaming devices
thread.title_full: Amazon will ban sale of Apple, Google video-streaming devices - Chicago Tribune

author: Tribune wire reports
title: Amazon will ban sale of Apple, Google video-streaming devices
text:
Amazon.com is flexing its e-commerce muscles to gain an edge on competitors in the video-streaming market by ending the sale of devices from Google and Apple.
The Seattle-based Web retailer sent an email to its marketplace sellers that it will stop selling Apple TV and Google's Chromecast. No new listings for the products will be allowed and posting of existing inventory will be removed Oct. 29, Amazon said. Amazon's streaming video service, called Prime Video, doesn't run easily on rival's devices.
Google's Marshmallow-Nexus-Chromecast event Blue Sky Innovation Google announced new Nexus phones, Chromecast 2 and updated its Android software today. LIVE BLOG RECAP Google announced new Nexus phones, Chromecast 2 and updated its Android software today. LIVE BLOG RECAP (Blue Sky Innovation) “Over the last three years, Prime Video has become an important part of Prime,” Amazon said in the email. “It's important that the streaming media players we sell interact well with Prime Video in order to avoid customer confusion.”
Roku Inc.’s hardware, Microsoft Corp.’s Xbox, and Sony Corp.’s PlayStation, which work with Amazon's Prime Video streaming service, aren't affected, Amazon said.
Amazon's Fire TV stick, which plugs into an HDMI port to connect televisions with streaming services such as Netflix and Prime Video, is the company's best-selling electronic device.
Bloomberg News
 Amazon.com Inc. Apple TV PlayStation Google Chromecast Xbox
